name: The Darkest Timeline
description: The convergence of timelines via the temporal anomaly crisis has brought the possibility of grimmer futures to the forefront. But while many see them as futures to avoid, there are those who see them as perfect.
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Rios, Elnor, Raffi, Displaced crew, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Uhura, the Borg Sphere 878, or the Miranda Class Ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Rios, Elnor, Raffi, or Displaced

featured_crew.name: Riker
featured_crew.flavor: Riker and his team make first contact with a new civilization whose ways of showing respect are very peculiar.

featured_crew.name: Elnor
featured_crew.flavor: Transported by Q to an alternate timeline, Elnor finds himself in great danger due to his Romulan heritage.

featured_crew.name: Raffi
featured_crew.flavor: Together with Seven and Rios, Raffi was sent back to 2024 Los Angeles to find the mysterious Watcher, the key to fixing the future.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Georgiou
rewards.flavor: Aboard the Discovery, Georgiou adopts the disguise of an Admiral when under inspection by the Earth Defense Force.

action.name: I Had To Make It Believable

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: Raffi
rewards.flavor: Together with Seven and Rios, Raffi was sent back to 2024 Los Angeles to find the mysterious Watcher, the key to fixing the future.

rewards.name: Skill

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Riker
rewards.flavor: Riker and his team make first contact with a new civilization whose ways of showing respect are very peculiar.

rewards.name: Raffi
rewards.flavor: Together with Seven and Rios, Raffi was sent back to 2024 Los Angeles to find the mysterious Watcher, the key to fixing the future.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Having so many show up here via temporal anomaly really puts things into perspective. We definitely have it better than some universes. And there are some versions of the timeline I get goosebumps just thinking about."

"How very human of you. Locked solely in your own narrow view of things. Meanwhile, there are others who would benefit greatly from those darker timelines. It's that short-sightedness that threatens peace across the galaxy even now."
"What is it with you and speaking in riddles, Q? Would it kill you to just come out with what it is you want to say for once?"

"He would probably ask you where the fun in that was, if he wasn't already off torturing someone else. I suspect he means the USS Uhura, stolen from spacedock. No contact can be made and no one can determine who is piloting the ship. Captain, please help us stop that ship."

"Having so many show up here via temporal anomaly really puts things into perspective. We definitely have it better than some universes. And there are some versions of the timeline I get goosebumps just thinking about."

"How very human of you. Locked solely in your own narrow view of things. Meanwhile, there are others who would benefit greatly from those darker timelines. It's that short-sightedness that threatens peace across the galaxy even now."
"What is it with you and speaking in riddles, Q? Would it kill you to just come out with what it is you want to say for once?"

"He would probably ask you where the fun in that was, if he wasn't already off torturing someone else. I suspect he means the USS Uhura, stolen from spacedock. No contact can be made and no one can determine who is piloting the ship. Captain, please help us stop that ship."

"Stand down. This vessel is ours. We will reset this timeline to be as it should - a timeline where we oversee the galaxy. The Federation. The Dominion. The Klingon and Romulan Empires. All will be assimilated into one true Collective. Your resistance is futile."

"The Borg Queen!? But...that can't really be Jurati, can it? She said her Collective was different. She wouldn't do something like steal the Uhura without a good reason, but everything stuff she's saying..."

responses.text: "How did you manage to steal the USS Uhura from spacedock all alone?"
"What would the Borg want with one little starship?"

screens.text: "I'm trying to make contact with her, but her voice is being drowned out. It isn't just her Collective. There are multiple Borg Queens connected to the Uhura. I'm having trouble maintaining my own individuality. Captain, try addressing them through me."

"You needn't worry. She is here. However, her motivations did not align with ours. So I am afraid she will have to wait until we can engage her in a little reeducation regarding the Borg's mission. Until then, we cannot have her poisoning the greater Collective."

"Captain, how many times must I tell you? When you're with the Borg, you're never alone. Also, you must speak with Starfleet about their numerous security flaws. We were not required to be anywhere near this ship, let alone on board. All it required was a few good connections."
"This one little starship, as it turns out, is the crux upon which the current timeline rests. What is it you humans call it? The 'Butterfly Effect'? What a quaint concept, and yet, how very apt."

"There are so many of them...Borg Queens from different times, timelines, universes, Collectives - all attempting to seize control of the Uhura! You're going to have to shut down most of her systems to break their connection and retrieve the ship!"

"Stand down. This vessel is ours. We will reset this timeline to be as it should - a timeline where we oversee the galaxy. The Federation. The Dominion. The Klingon and Romulan Empires. All will be assimilated into one true Collective. Your resistance is futile."

"The Borg Queen!? But...that can't really be Jurati, can it? She said her Collective was different. She wouldn't do something like steal the Uhura without a good reason, but everything stuff she's saying..."

"What would the Borg want with one little starship?"

"You needn't worry. She is here. However, her motivations did not align with ours. So I am afraid she will have to wait until we can engage her in a little reeducation regarding the Borg's mission. Until then, we cannot have her poisoning the greater Collective."

"Captain, how many times must I tell you? When you're with the Borg, you're never alone. Also, you must speak with Starfleet about their numerous security flaws. We were not required to be anywhere near this ship, let alone on board. All it required was a few good connections."
"This one little starship, as it turns out, is the crux upon which the current timeline rests. What is it you humans call it? The 'Butterfly Effect'? What a quaint concept, and yet, how very apt."

"There are so many of them...Borg Queens from different times, timelines, universes, Collectives - all attempting to seize control of the Uhura! You're going to have to shut down most of her systems to break their connection and retrieve the ship!"
